Class Board

java.lang.Object
game.core.Board
public final class Board extends Object
Represents the Hex game board, managing the grid state, move history, and connectivity checks.

This class uses a 1D array to store cell colors for performance and a UnionFind data structure to efficiently check for winning conditions (connections between opposite sides). It also maintains a history of moves to support undo functionality.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int n)
      Constructs a new empty Board of size n x n. * @param n the dimension of the board (number of rows and columns)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if n is less than or equal to 0

    • Board

      private Board(int n, Color[] cells, UnionFind uf)

  • Method Details

    • fastCopy

      public Board fastCopy()
      Creates a deep copy of the current board state.

      This method copies the cell array and the underlying UnionFind structure, allowing for safe simulation of moves without affecting the original board. * @return a new Board instance identical to the current one

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the size of the board (the 'n' in n x n). * @return the number of rows (or columns)

    • getCell

      public Color getCell(int row, int column)
      Retrieves the color of the cell at the specified coordinates. * @param row the row index (0-based)
      Parameters:
      column - the column index (0-based)
      Returns:
      the Color of the cell (RED, BLACK, or EMPTY)
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are invalid (via internal array access)

    • getMoveRed

      public void getMoveRed(int row, int column, Color _ignored)
      Places a RED stone at the specified coordinates.

      This updates the board state and the connectivity graph. * @param row the row index

      Parameters:
      column - the column index
      _ignored - unused parameter, kept for signature compatibility
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the cell is not empty
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if coordinates are out of bounds

    • getMoveBlack

      public void getMoveBlack(int row, int column, Color _ignored)
      Places a BLACK stone at the specified coordinates.

      This updates the board state and the connectivity graph. * @param row the row index

      Parameters:
      column - the column index
      _ignored - unused parameter, kept for signature compatibility
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the cell is not empty
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if coordinates are out of bounds

    • inBounds

      public boolean inBounds(int row, int column)
      Checks if the given coordinates represent a valid position on the board. * @param row the row index
      Parameters:
      column - the column index
      Returns:
      true if the position is within the board limits, false otherwise

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty(int row, int column)
      Checks if a specific cell is currently empty. * @param row the row index
      Parameters:
      column - the column index
      Returns:
      true if the cell is in bounds and its color is EMPTY, false otherwise

    • redWins

      public boolean redWins()
      Checks if the Red player has won.

      Red wins by connecting the top edge to the bottom edge. * @return true if Red has a connecting path, false otherwise

    • blackWins

      public boolean blackWins()
      Checks if the Black player has won.

      Black wins by connecting the left edge to the right edge. * @return true if Black has a connecting path, false otherwise

    • isTerminal

      public boolean isTerminal()
      Determines if the game has reached a terminal state (win/loss).

      Since draws are impossible in Hex, this returns true if either Red or Black has won. * @return true if a player has won, false otherwise

    • legalMoves

      public List<int[]> legalMoves()
      Generates a list of all valid moves available on the current board. * @return a list of int arrays, where each array is {row, col} for an empty cell

    • terminate

      private void terminate(int row, int column, Color stone)
      Returns the number of moves currently stored in the history stack. * @return the size of the move history

    • undoMove

      public boolean undoMove()
      Undoes the last move. Optimized for MCTS tree traversal.
      Returns:
      true if a move was undone, false if no moves to undo

    • getMoveHistorySize

      public int getMoveHistorySize()
      Returns the number of moves currently stored in the history stack. * @return the size of the move history

    • clearMoveHistory

      public void clearMoveHistory()
      Clears the history of moves.

      This effectively prevents undoMove() from being used for prior moves. It is often used when synchronizing state or starting a fresh phase.

    • neighbors

      public List<int[]> neighbors(int row, int column)
      Returns a list of valid neighboring coordinates for a given cell.

      In a Hex grid, a cell has up to 6 neighbors. * @param row the row index

      Parameters:
      column - the column index
      Returns:
      a list of int arrays representing neighbor coordinates {r, c}

    • idx

      private int idx(int row, int column)

    • clearCell

      public void clearCell(int row, int column)
      Forcibly sets a specific cell to EMPTY.

      This does not update the UnionFind structure or move history automatically. It is primarily used for resetting or undoing operations. * @param row the row index

      Parameters:
      column - the column index

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the board to its initial state.

      All cells are cleared to EMPTY, and the UnionFind structure is reset.
